definitions: in a very skilled manner; excellently
in a manner worthy of or eliciting admiration

examples.text: Miss Bingley was dressed very finely

shortDefinitions: in manner worthy of or eliciting admiration

definitions: into very thin or small pieces
shortDefinitions: into very thin or small pieces

examples.text: a rod of finely sharpened iron

definitions: made or consisting of small particles or threads

examples.text: the flesh is smooth and finely textured

shortDefinitions: made or consisting of small particles or threads

definitions: with delicate or intricate workmanship or structure
shortDefinitions: with delicate or intricate workmanship or structure

definitions: in a subtle or sensitive manner

examples.text: we are trying to judge answers too finely
the contest for the presidency is finely balanced
they both turn in finely nuanced performances
